text: The 2014 Rogers Cup presented by National Bank (named as a result of a sponsor) is a tennis tournament which takes place on outdoor Hardcourts. It started on 2 August and will end on 10 August. The tournament is in the 125th year of the Canadian Open which is a tournament that takes place yearly. The men's and women's tournaments switch between Toronto and Montreal. The tournament is part of the 2014 ATP World Tour and 2014 WTA Tour. It is used to prepare players for the 2014 US Open. ==Ranking points and prize money== Men's Singles draw Men's Singles draw Men's Singles draw Outcome Prizemoney Points Winner $547,300 1000 Runner-up $268,350 600 Semifinalist $135,060 360 Quarterfinalist $68,680 180 Round 3 $35,660 90 Round 2 $18,800 45 Round 1 $10,155 10 Men's Doubles draw Men's Doubles draw Men's Doubles draw Outcome Prizemoney Ranking Winner $169,500 1000 Runner-up $83,000 600 Semifinalist $41,620 360 Quarterfinalist $21,360 180 Round 2 $11,040 90 Round 1 $5,820 0 Women's Singles draw Women's Singles draw Women's Singles draw Outcome Prizemoney Points Winner $441,000 900 Runner-up $220,000 585 Semifinalist $110,100 350 Quarterfinalist $50,700 190 Round 3 $25,135 105 Round 2 $12,900 60 Round 1 $6,630 1 Women's Doubles draw Women's Doubles draw Women's Doubles draw Outcome Prizemoney Ranking Winner $122,000 900 Runner-up $61,600 585 Semifinalist $30,490 350 Quarterfinalist $15,340 190 Round 2 $7,780 105 Round 1 $3,840 1 ==Seeded players== A seed is a competitor who is given special placement in a tournament. This is so they do not meet the best players until the later rounds in the tournament. Usually they meet in the third round and may have received a pass into the second round. ===Men's Singles=== ===Women's Singles=== ===Men's Doubles=== ===Women's Doubles=== ==Finals== ===Men's Singles=== ===Women's Singles=== ===Men's Doubles=== ===Women's Doubles=== ==Sources== ==Other websites== *Official website Category:2014 ATP World Tour Category:2014 WTA Tour Category:2014 in tennis Category:Hard court tennis tournaments Category:Sport in Canada Category:2014 in Canada Category:2010s in Toronto Category:21st century in Montreal Category:August 2014 events
